First was a timely talk by Sanna Ojanperä skill development for cloudworkers at the Digital Futures at #Work Research Centre (Digit). This #MixedMethods approach has so much depth and illuminates many avenues for further development. Highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jomvxxoTIuU (2/12) #GigWorkers #platforms #skills #HR

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wfaj8DfC.title: Computational Antitrust: Working Solutions (Fox, Melamed, Cao, Budzinski, Noskova, Groza)

last_post.content: Next was a fantastic slate of talks on computational #antitrust solutions (M&A #simulations, #NLP, etc.) at #StanfordCodeX's Computational Antitrust Conference by Siying (Kate) Cao, Victoriia Noskova, Oliver Budzinski, Eleanor Fox, Doug Melamed, and Teodora Groza. Highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wfaj8DfCnsw (3/12)

Next was a talk on reverse engineering computation in the #brain by Matthew Golub. It was extremely interesting to see proof of actual computation in the brain for the first time https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=edtYok4KL7k (4/12)

Next was a number of rapid-fire #startup presentations at #StanfordCodeX. The presentation by Alesia Ash, Erin Weaver, and Tate Richardson on legal #tech innovation for #justice was particularly good https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z3tjAk0RUaE (5/12)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sOyiYZU5.title: Basic Order: The International Monetary and Financial System Meets Security | Tucker | Part 2 of 2

last_post.content: Next was an in-depth talk on the importance of monetary standards for #business and international #power by Paul Tucker at the #StiglerCenter for the Study of the #Economy and the State. This will get you thinking, highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sOyiYZU5mdo (6/12)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fx2wegnU.title: DSI Distinguished Speaker: Matthew J. Salganik, Princeton

last_post.content: Next was an incredible talk by Matthew Salganik on predicting life outcomes and how to engage in meaningful #ComputationalSocialScience at the #DataScience Institute at #Columbia University. This gets to the meat of how to think about research and practice in this area, highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fx2wegnUZ54 (7/12)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e05qPyg6.title: Research Ethics and Policy Series (REPS): Atheendar Venkataramani, MD, PhD

last_post.content: Next was an important talk by Atheendar Venkataramani on the benefits, ethical concerns, and engagement approach for concentrated investments in Black neighborhoods from a #PublicHealth and #bioethics perspective at the #UPenn School of Medicine https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e05qPyg67VE (8/12)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hvQuCdSz.title: A public dialogue on location data ethics

last_post.content: Next was an interesting discussion on the public's view of location #data #ethics at The #AlanTuringInstitute with Skye McCool and Aidan Peppin. Prepare for some surprising results here, illustrating the importance of not assuming we know what the public thinks on tech ethics issues. Highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hvQuCdSzmfU (9/12)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QyGIjc9y.title: March 10 - Anjana Susarla, Michigan State University Broad College of Business

last_post.content: Next was a thorough talk by @asusarla on the effects of #health #information on #YouTube at the #MIT Initiative on the Digital #Economy. Spoiler alert - recommending authoritative health #videos that people will actually watch consistently is hard https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QyGIjc9y0FU (10/12)

last_post.content: Next was a novel talk by Kobi Gal on #AI supported collaborative student #learning. It does seem like AI actually adds something in the setup here by surfacing underlying issues accurately https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ug5-K6xojv8 (11/12)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmZ3QSnw.title: Yunus Telliel: Anthropology, Robotics/AI Research, and the Interdisciplinarity

last_post.content: Last was an excellent discussion with @yunusdogantelliel on the future of "The Future of Work" at @chiwork. This is an essential conversation for folks in #management, #PeopleAnalytics, and #tech, as it gets to the importance of questioning our framings and bringing together various methods and #ethics throughout the process of creating #work futures. Highly recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmZ3QSnwGWg (12/12)

dbpedia_genre: DBpedia work-genre network. A bipartite network of the affiliations between artists and their works on one side and genre classifications on the other, as extracted from Wikipedia by the DBpedia project. https://networks.skewed.de/net/dbpedia_genre

Why do overall gender/racial/etc disparities in the follow network matter? Social media attention:
- improves job prospects
- gets academics more citations (& money/promotions etc)
- shapes the careers of journalists

And despite claims that Twitter was an equalizer, it concentrated attention inequalities on average.

See Usher & Holcomb on this: https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/1940161218781254?casa_token=xFnipMcj3MkAAAAA%3ApXnzxTyfzdyXDcbAdK3wMLV7IWXw6h-n6ODeBW9d8RnNpekXbKGx_CF-l7M4P3xjZsDsRK-gbKYEQA

It’s kind of wild to see that we’re about to pass a law to ban TikTok on government devices.

I remember when Trump trying to do so seemed like a childish outburst because kids pranked him and bragged on the app.

It now seems like conventional wisdom that it’s a national security threat yet it’s OK if civilians keep using it? Weird.

You probably already knew to do this, but: Even the FBI says you should use an ad blocker, https://techcrunch.com/2022/12/22/fbi-ad-blocker/, via https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=34095107
Why? Because of too many malicious ads that impersonate legitimate brands and trick people into installing malware or revealing their login credentials. Original FBI announcement https://www.ic3.gov/Media/Y2022/PSA221221?=8324278624

last_post.content:
Ever wondered about the development in the board elections of @ThePSF over the past years?

Did you know that there are 3 types of PSF members who can vote? Fellows, Contributing or Managing, and Supporting?

The PSF Diversity & Inclusion group is preparing a really cool event where you can ask anything about all these things.

We will announce it soon, so stay tuned!

In the meantime dive into this interactive chart on @observablehq

https://observablehq.com/@terezaif/who-voted-in-the-psf-board-elections

Elon Musk is Still Silencing the Journalists he Banned from Twitter.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uLK5QP9J.title: REVEALED: Pentagon Psy-Op EXPOSED In Twitter Files | Counter Points

last_post.content:
The new twitter is garbage, and Musk is despicable.

But the old twitter was only less smelly garbage, and the reporting by Lee Fang on how they collaborated with the pentagon to create fake accounts to influence foreign politics is a great example.

Everyone in the US goes bananas when accusing the Russians of doing stuff like this, but when evidence comes of the same thing done by the US — then it's silence.

The underlying reason is clear: most people in the US — republicans and democrats alike — actually think this is justified.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uLK5QP9JKXc

"Just because a model correlates with brain and behaviour data, it is not sufficient for us to infer that the model is performing cognition: correlation does not imply cognition." 1/2
